body:
I'm having the same issue trying to install latest stable on a Raspberry Pi Zero W running Raspbian Buster Lite v4.19:

=== REDIS BUG REPORT START: Cut & paste starting from here ===
29505:M 20 May 2020 00:00:58.823 # === ASSERTION FAILED ===
29505:M 20 May 2020 00:00:58.823 # ==> networking.c:2749 'c->reply_bytes < SIZE_MAX-(1024*64)' is not true
29505:M 20 May 2020 00:00:58.823 # (forcing SIGSEGV to print the bug report.)
29505:M 20 May 2020 00:00:58.823 # Redis 6.0.3 crashed by signal: 11
29505:M 20 May 2020 00:00:58.824 # Crashed running the instruction at: 0x7a5b0
29505:M 20 May 2020 00:00:58.824 # Accessing address: 0xffffffff
29505:M 20 May 2020 00:00:58.824 # Failed assertion: c->reply_bytes < SIZE_MAX-(1024*64) (networking.c:2749)

FWIW I downgraded to 5.0.8 and `make test` finished properly. Maybe I can reinstall alongside and try?
I have the same problem. Have you solved it?

I suspect the value of `SIZE_MAX` is not `ULONG_MAX` in your environment @56600535 @accua 
Please help me do a test https://github.com/antirez/redis/issues/7275#issuecomment-631219319 in your redis environment.
Compile the code (https://github.com/antirez/redis/issues/7275#issuecomment-631219319) in the environment where you compile your redis, and run it in your redis environment. @56600535 thanks

@ShooterIT 

SIZE_MAX = 4294967295
ULONG_MAX = 4294967295
ULLONG_MAX = 18446744073709551615

This is the result of the operation

@ShooterIT 
This error occurs only when running redis-cli.Redis-server can be started normally.
hi @56600535 could you paste your coredump log just like above?

@ShooterIT
